Publications

Eisenberg, R. M., R. M. Sandrelli, D. Tucker, J. Monk, D. Boyce, É. Vadboncoeur, J. A. Porter, and A. K. Gamperl. 2025. “The Thermal Dependent Biology of Cultured Lumpfish (Cyclopterus Lumpus Linnaeus 1758): Differences Due to Temperatures During Early Life and How Tolerance Is Measured.” Aquaculture 595 (January): 741694. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaculture.2024.741694.
Ignatz, Eric H., Rebeccah M. Sandrelli, Émile Vadboncoeur, Fábio S. Zanuzzo, Guy M. L. Perry, Matthew L. Rise, and A. Kurt Gamperl. 2023. “The Atlantic Salmon’s (Salmo Salar) Incremental Thermal Maximum Is a More Relevant and Sensitive Indicator of Family-Based Differences in Upper Temperature Tolerance Than Its Critical Thermal Maximum.” Aquaculture 574 (September): 739628. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaculture.2023.739628.
Kong, Jacinta D, Marshall W Ritchie, Émile Vadboncoeur, Heath A MacMillan, and Susan M Bertram. 2025a. “Growth, Development, and Life History of a Mass-Reared Edible Insect, Gryllodes Sigillatus (Orthoptera: Gryllidae).” Journal of Economic Entomology, April, toaf073. https://doi.org/10.1093/jee/toaf073.
Kong, Jacinta D., Émile Vadboncoeur, Susan M. Bertram, and Heath A. MacMillan. 2025b. “Temperature-Dependence of Life History in an Edible Cricket: Implications for Optimising Mass-Rearing.” Current Research in Insect Science 7 (January): 100109. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cris.2025.100109.
Rojas, Isis, Albert Caballero-Solares, Émile Vadboncoeur, Rebeccah M. Sandrelli, Jennifer R. Hall, Kathy A. Clow, Christopher C. Parrish, Matthew L. Rise, Andrew K. Swanson, and Anthony K. Gamperl. 2024. “Prolonged Cold Exposure Negatively Impacts Atlantic Salmon (Salmo Salar) Liver Metabolism and Function.” Biology 13 (7): 494. https://doi.org/10.3390/biology13070494.
Sandrelli, Rebeccah M., Émile Vadboncoeur, Sheldon George, Eric H. Ignatz, Andrew K. Swanson, and A. Kurt Gamperl. 2025. “Understanding How Winter Conditions in the North Atlantic Affect the Physiology and Behaviour of Atlantic Salmon in Sea-Cages.” Aquaculture 596 (February): 741777. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaculture.2024.741777.
Vadboncoeur, Émile, Marie-Hélène Deschamps, Susan M. Bertram, and Heath A. MacMillan. 2025. “Temperature Outweighs Diet in Shaping Developmental Performance in Two Cricket Species via Growth Delays and Physiological Limits.” Journal of Experimental Biology 228 (24): jeb251472. https://doi.org/10.1242/jeb.251472.
Vadboncoeur, Émile, Charlotte Nelson, Kathy A. Clow, Rebeccah M. Sandrelli, Colin J. Brauner, Andrew K. Swanson, and A. Kurt Gamperl. 2023. “‘Cold Shock’ Has Few Physiological Effects on Cultured Atlantic Salmon (Salmo Salar) Acclimated to Low Temperatures.” Aquaculture 577 (December): 739900. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaculture.2023.739900.
Vadboncoeur, Émile, Charlotte Nelson, Jennifer R. Hall, Kathy A. Clow, Rebeccah M. Sandrelli, Colin J. Brauner, Andrew K. Swanson, and A. Kurt Gamperl. 2023. “Lowering Temperature to 1 \(^\circ\)C Results in Physiological Changes, Stress and Mortality in Cultured Atlantic Salmon (Salmo Salar).” Aquaculture 568 (April): 739313. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaculture.2023.739313.

Swanson, and Anthony Kurt Gamperl. 2024. “Increased Liver Size and Dysfunction, Ionoregulatory Disturbance and Opportunistic Infections in Atlantic Salmon ( Salmo Salar ) at Low Temperatures: A Case Study.” Aquaculture, Fish and Fisheries 4 (6): e70021. https://doi.org/10.1002/aff2.70021.
